sn35.106:4.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the origin and ending of suffering.
sn35.106:4.3: And what, mendicants, is the origin of suffering?
sn35.106:4.4: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights.
sn35.106:4.5: The meeting of the three is contact.
sn35.106:4.6: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn35.106:4.7: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn35.106:4.8: This is the origin of suffering …
sn35.106:4.14: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and phenomena.
sn35.106:4.15: The meeting of the three is contact.
sn35.106:4.16: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn35.106:4.17: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn35.106:4.18: This is the origin of suffering.
sn35.106:5.1: And what is the ending of suffering?
sn35.106:5.2: Eye consciousness arises dependent on the eye and sights.
sn35.106:5.3: The meeting of the three is contact.
sn35.106:5.4: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn35.106:5.5: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn35.106:5.6: When that craving fades away and ceases with nothing left over, grasping ceases.
sn35.106:5.7: When grasping ceases, future existence ceases.
sn35.106:5.8: When future existence ceases, rebirth ceases.
sn35.106:5.9: When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
sn35.106:5.10: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn35.106:5.11: This is the ending of suffering. …
sn35.106:5.13: Mind consciousness arises dependent on the mind and phenomena.
sn35.106:5.14: The meeting of the three is contact.
sn35.106:5.15: Contact is a condition for feeling.
sn35.106:5.16: Feeling is a condition for craving.
sn35.106:5.17: When that craving fades away and ceases with nothing left over, grasping ceases.
sn35.106:5.18: When grasping ceases, future existence ceases.
sn35.106:5.19: When future existence ceases, rebirth ceases.
sn35.106:5.20: When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, crying, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
sn35.106:5.21: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.
sn35.106:5.22: This is the ending of suffering.”
